title: Ensnared
content:
Ensnared Ensnared creatures take 1d6Piercing damage at the start of each turn. Can't move and Attack Rolls against the creature have Advantage, while creature's Attack Rolls and Dexterity Saving Throw have Disadvantage. The creature or an ally can use its action to tear away the vines.

Ensnared creatures take 1d6Piercing damage at the start of each turn.

Can't move and Attack Rolls against the creature have Advantage, while creature's Attack Rolls and Dexterity Saving Throw have Disadvantage.

The creature or an ally can use its action to tear away the vines.

Ensnared is a Status Effect in Baldur's Gate 3. Status Effects are the different conditions that can affect characters in both positive and negative ways.

Ensnared Information

Effect: Ensnared creatures take 1d6 Piercing damage at the start of each turn. The creature or an ally can use its action to tear away the vines.

How to Acquire Ensnared

Can be applied by Ensnaring Strike

How to Remove Ensnared

The "ensnared" condition can be removed by using the "help" action on the affected character. Note that help can not be used on self.

Ensnared Notes & Tips

Notes and tips go here.
